questions.question: What are the three main components of a weaving draft?
choices: Threading, tie-up, and treadling
Warp, weft, and shed
Color, pattern, and texture
Loom, shuttle, and heddle
questions.answer: Threading, tie-up, and treadling

questions.question: In a weaving draft, which component represents how warp threads are arranged on the loom?
choices: Threading
Tie-up
Treadling
Drawdown
questions.answer: Threading

questions.question: What does the tie-up in a weaving draft indicate?
choices: Which shafts are connected to which treadles
The order of weft insertion
The color sequence of the warp
The tension of the warp threads
questions.answer: Which shafts are connected to which treadles

questions.question: In a weaving draft, how is the treadling sequence read?
choices: From top to bottom
From left to right
From right to left
From bottom to top
questions.answer: From top to bottom

questions.question: What does the drawdown in a weaving draft represent?
choices: Visual representation of the final fabric structure
The process of removing the fabric from the loom
The tension adjustment of the warp threads
The speed at which the weaver operates the loom
questions.answer: Visual representation of the final fabric structure

questions.question: Which color harmony uses colors opposite each other on the color wheel?
choices: Complementary
Analogous
Triadic
Monochromatic
questions.answer: Complementary

questions.question: What is optical mixing in woven textiles?
choices: Colors blend visually when woven in small patterns
The process of dyeing yarns before weaving
Using optical fibers in the weaving process
Adjusting the loom's tension for better visibility
questions.answer: Colors blend visually when woven in small patterns

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a method for modernizing traditional designs?
choices: Replicating exact traditional patterns
Simplification
Scale adjustment
Color modification
questions.answer: Replicating exact traditional patterns

questions.question: What is the purpose of creating a weaving draft?
choices: To plan and communicate complex patterns
To calculate the cost of materials
To determine the weaving speed
To measure the strength of the yarn
questions.answer: To plan and communicate complex patterns

questions.question: In color theory, what are analogous colors?
choices: Colors adjacent on the color wheel
Colors opposite on the color wheel
Primary colors only
Black, white, and gray
questions.answer: Colors adjacent on the color wheel

questions.question: What is the significance of understanding color dominance in woven textiles?
choices: It affects the overall appearance of the fabric
It determines the strength of the fabric
It influences the weaving speed
It dictates the type of loom to be used
questions.answer: It affects the overall appearance of the fabric

questions.question: Which of the following is a common geometric pattern in traditional Timorese motifs?
choices: Diamonds
Spirals
Circles
Hexagons
questions.answer: Diamonds

questions.question: What is the benefit of simplifying complex motifs in modern adaptations?
choices: It focuses on key elements of the design
It makes the weaving process faster
It reduces the cost of materials
It increases the fabric's durability
questions.answer: It focuses on key elements of the design

questions.question: How can traditional motifs be incorporated into contemporary patterns?
choices: Use them as borders or accents in modern designs
Replicate them exactly without any changes
Eliminate them completely from new designs
Use them only in traditional garments
questions.answer: Use them as borders or accents in modern designs

questions.question: What is the purpose of the threading diagram in a weaving draft?
choices: To show how warp threads are arranged on the loom
To indicate the color of the weft threads
To determine the weaving pattern
To calculate the fabric's shrinkage
questions.answer: To show how warp threads are arranged on the loom

questions.question: In a weaving draft, what do black squares in the tie-up section indicate?
choices: A connection between shaft and treadle
The use of dark-colored yarn
Areas where the fabric will be cut
Mistakes in the weaving process
questions.answer: A connection between shaft and treadle

questions.question: What is the term for one pass of the weft in weaving?
choices: Pick
Thread
Shaft
Heddle
questions.answer: Pick

questions.question: Which color harmony creates high contrast and vibrant designs?
choices: Complementary
Analogous
Monochromatic
Pastel
questions.answer: Complementary

questions.question: What is the effect of using analogous colors in weaving?
choices: Creates harmonious, subtle designs
Produces high contrast patterns
Results in black and white fabrics
Causes the fabric to appear three-dimensional
questions.answer: Creates harmonious, subtle designs

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a primary color?
choices: Green
Red
Blue
Yellow
questions.answer: Green

questions.question: What is the purpose of altering the frequency or arrangement of motifs in modern adaptations?
choices: To create new rhythms with traditional elements
To make the fabric easier to produce
To increase the fabric's strength
To reduce the use of color in the design
questions.answer: To create new rhythms with traditional elements

questions.question: How does optical mixing differ in woven textiles compared to painting?
choices: Colors blend when woven in small patterns
Woven textiles cannot achieve optical mixing
Painting always produces more vibrant colors
Optical mixing only occurs in digital textile design
questions.answer: Colors blend when woven in small patterns

questions.question: What is the significance of understanding warp and weft interaction in color theory for weaving?
choices: It produces different effects when colors cross
It determines the fabric's washing instructions
It affects the loom's operation speed
It influences the fabric's resistance to fading
questions.answer: It produces different effects when colors cross

questions.question: Which of the following is a method for incorporating traditional elements in contemporary patterns?
choices: Integrating traditional symbols into abstract compositions
Using only modern motifs and avoiding traditional elements
Replicating traditional patterns without any modifications
Eliminating all symbolic meanings from the designs
questions.answer: Integrating traditional symbols into abstract compositions

questions.question: What is the purpose of creating a color palette inspired by Timorese textiles?
choices: To honor traditional color usage while exploring modern combinations
To exactly replicate traditional color schemes
To avoid using any colors found in traditional textiles
To use only primary colors in new designs
questions.answer: To honor traditional color usage while exploring modern combinations

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical symbolic motif in traditional Timorese textiles?
choices: Elephants
Crocodiles
Roosters
Ancestral figures
questions.answer: Elephants

questions.question: What is the benefit of understanding weaving drafts for Timorese weavers entering modern markets?
choices: It allows for the creation of more complex and marketable designs
It makes the weaving process faster
It reduces the cost of materials
It eliminates the need for traditional weaving skills
questions.answer: It allows for the creation of more complex and marketable designs

questions.question: How can color theory be applied to create more appealing products for international markets?
choices: By using color harmonies that appeal to diverse cultural preferences
By using only traditional Timorese color combinations
By avoiding bright colors in all designs
By using only black and white in modern designs
questions.answer: By using color harmonies that appeal to diverse cultural preferences

questions.question: What is the purpose of studying traditional Timorese motifs in a modern weaving course?
choices: To preserve cultural heritage while exploring innovation
To replicate traditional textiles without any changes
To phase out the use of traditional designs
To limit creativity in modern textile design
questions.answer: To preserve cultural heritage while exploring innovation

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the relationship between warp and weft in creating fabric patterns?
choices: Their interaction determines the final appearance of the fabric
Only the warp threads contribute to the pattern
The weft has no impact on the fabric's design
Warp and weft always create the same pattern regardless of their arrangement
questions.answer: Their interaction determines the final appearance of the fabric
